data.text:
Jane Wyman has lived a long and fulfilling career as an actress that began when she was around 16 and spanned 7 decades. During this period, she had several works to her credit and was repeatedly voted as the most popular star in the country. In addition to her storied acting career, Jane was also known for being the first wife of actor and former President of the United States – Ronald Regan -, and they were married from 1940 until their divorce in 1949. learn more about the events in the life of the actress and what caused her death.

Jane Wyman’s Bio

At first, Jane Wyman went by Sarah JaneMayfield after she was born on January 5, 1917 in the town of Saint Joseph, Missouri, USA to Gladys Hope (née Christian; born 1895 – died 1960) and Manning Jeffries Mayfield (born in 1895 – died in 1922). Her father worked as a laborer in a catering company while her mother was an office assistant and stenographer for a doctor. His mother filed for divorce from his father in October 1921, and his father died the following year. Sarah’s mother later moved to Cleveland, Ohio as she left her daughter in the care of Emma (née Reiss; 1866 – 1951) and Richard D. Fulks (1862 – 1928) as parents adoptive. VS’

Jane Wyman began her career in 1928 as a radio singer named Jane Durrell. She was actually underage at the time but faked her age so she could get the job. In 1932, Jane abandoned her studies and returned to Hollywood where she hoped to make a career as an actress. She started out with a few odd jobs, first as a manicurist and then as a switchboard operator before beginning to take on uncredited roles that lasted until 1936. Her first recorded film credit (uncredited) was in The Kid from Spain (1932), while her first credited role was as Dixie the Hat Check Girl in Clever Blonde (1937).

Some other works she starred in include Tail Spin, Torchy Blane… Playing with Dynamite, Private Investigator, All in 1939, Night Crime (1944), Trac (1950), Holidays for Lovers (1959), How to Initiate Marriage (1969 and The Incredible Adventure of Doctor Meg Laurel (1979).

Net value

Jane Wyman had a very successful career as she lived however you want to explain your career success. She has earned respect as an actress, singer and dancer with numerous awards and recognition to show for it. She has earned a net worth of around $15 million.

Family – Spouse (spouse)

Sarah Jane Mayfield who mostly liked to identify herself with her foster family’s surname before her marriage often wrote her name Jane Fulks. She was married 5 times with 4 husbands, the first being Ernest Wyman (born in 1906 – died in 1970) on April 8, 1933 in Los Angeles, California, when she was a teenager. However, 2 years later, the two divorced but Jane kept her husband’s last name for professional purposes and went to Jane Wyman.

Her second marriage was to Myron Futterman (born 1900 – died 1965) on June 29, 1937. A problem arose after three months of marriage: Jane wanted to have children, but her husband did not. Thus, they divorced on December 15, 1938.

It was through her marriage to the late Ronald Reagan, an actor at the time, that Jane became more famous. The two met while working on Brother Rat (1938), and were together again Brother Rat and a Baby (1940) during which they got bitten by love. On January 26, 1940, they were married at Wee Kirk o’Heather Church, Glendale, California, but in 1949 they were officially divorced. During the duration of their marriage, the spouses were the parents of Maureen Elizabeth Reagan (their biological daughter, 1941-2001), Michael Edward Reagan (adopted son born March 18, 1945) and Christine Reagan, who unfortunately died on the day of her marriage. birth (June 26)., 1947) due to his premature birth.

After Regan, Wyman married Frederick Karger (born 1916 – died 1979) on November 1, 1952, only to separate two years later on November 7, 1954. The divorce was not final as they remarried on March 11 1961, but on March 9, 1965, Karger divorced her. Jane citing that Jane left him.

Dead

Jane Wyman lived a turbulent life, from being abandoned by her birth mother, taken in by foster parents, to repeatedly changing her age in an effort to be accepted to do what she wasn’t good enough for. big in time. Maybe it was for good intentions and besides her successful career, she is remembered for her prestigious marriages.

The TV star’s career spanned a total of 70 years after which she retired from active theater in the early 90s. She last breathed on September 10, 2007 at her home in Rancho Mirage while sleeping. The cause of his death would have been natural. Jane was later buried in Forest Lawn Mortuary and Memorial Park, located in Cathedral City, California. The famous actress leaves behind her son Michael Regan, her grandchildren Cameron and Ashley and her daughter-in-law Colleen.
